Bird | blank2_info_sec1 = Calystegia soldanella | blank2_name_sec1 = - Flower | blank1_info_sec1 = Japanese black pine & Camellia sasanqua | blank1_name_sec1 = - Tree | blank_info_sec1 = | area_footnotes = | unit_pref = | native_name = | image_shield = | pushpin_label_position = | pushpin_map = Japan | map_caption = Location of Ōiso in Kanagawa Prefecture | map_alt = | image_map = Oiso in Kanagawa Prefecture Ja.svg | motto = | nickname = | image_blank_emblem = | shield_alt = | seal_alt = | pushpin_map_caption = | image_seal = Emblem of Oiso, Kanagawa.svg | flag_alt = | image_flag = Flag of Oiso, Kanagawa.svg | image_caption = Ōiso Town Hall | image_alt = | imagesize = | image_skyline = Oiso Town Office.JPG | settlement_type = Town | native_name_lang = ja | pushpin_map_alt = | coordinates = | total_type = | founder = | leader_name1 = | leader_title1 = | leader_name = | leader_title = Mayor | leader_party = | government_footnotes = | seat = | seat_type = | named_for = | established_date = | coor_pinpoint = | established_title = | subdivision_name3 = Naka | subdivision_type3 = District | subdivision_name2 = Kanagawa Prefecture | subdivision_type2 = Prefecture | subdivision_name1 = Kantō | subdivision_type1 = Region | subdivision_name = Japan | subdivision_type = Country | coordinates_footnotes = | footnotes = }} is a Japanese town in Kanagawa Prefecture on the island of Honshū. ==History== In the Edo period, Ōiso-juku was 8th of the 53 shogunate-maintained waystations (shuku-eki) along the Tōkaidō road which connected Edo and Kyoto.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Tōkaidō" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 973. ==Geography== Ōiso is on the coastline of Sagami Bay. ==Related pages== * The Fifty-three Stations of the Tōkaidō ==References== == Other websites == * Town of Oiso website ; Category:Towns in Japan Category:Settlements in Kanagawa Prefecture
title: Ōiso
